name: Umbilical Granuloma
chief_complaint: My baby's belly button has a red, moist lump that won't go away
physical_findings: Small (2-10mm) pink-red granular tissue at umbilicus
prognosis: Excellent with treatment, typically resolves completely
description: A common benign condition in newborns where excess granulation tissue persists at the umbilicus after cord separation. Forms when epithelialization is incomplete during healing.
